calculations.delete-warning-dependency: Deleting this calculation field is permanent and cannot be reverted. It is currently used in other entities, which might be affected by its removal. Are you sure that you want to delete it?

settings.bundle-not-set: Basic bundle alias is not set
settings.url-path-tooltip: The URL path after the domain name. After updating this field, a page reload is required.
settings.use-prefix-tooltip: The URL path after the domain name. After changing, a page reload is required.
settings.want-upload-bundle: Do you want to upload Widget Bundle?

tasks.clear-all-executions-warning: Are you sure that you want to clear all the executions of all your tasks?
tasks.stop-task-warning: Are you sure that you want to stop all the executions of all your tasks?
tasks.stop-all-task-warning: Are you sure that you want to stop all the executions of all your tasks?

type.pred-model-refresh: Save prediction model result to TB

calculations.batch: When batch calculation option is disabled - you write a function that works with 1 value at a time. But when a batch calculation is enabled you work with the whole raw telemetry array.
calculations.data-type: You can select real data to test the script if it is already available. Or create your own manually.
calculations.entity: Choosing the business entity to which this calculation field will be linked in the entity settings and on the visualizations page. This selection also impacts the Entity filters on the Input tab.
calculations.fill-gap: A tool for filling in missing telemetry using one of the selected methods.
calculations.function: This field serves as the input area for the Calculation Field code
calculations.item: Device/asset whose telemetry you want to use for testing your function.
calculations.key: Telemetry name for saving calculation data in ThingsBoard: "_ECD_your-calculation-key"
calculations.time-range-strategy: During the refresh task execution, the system loads data by the time range set by a particular strategy. Dynamic strategy will load only new data for the calculation field that appeared since the last execution. Fixed strategy will use the same predefined range for each next execution.

dashboard.dashboard-link: You should indicate link to external IoT platform in settings
dashboard.filter: You have not added any filters to the current view.
dashboard.widget-with-alias: A widget with an alias can change its data using the dashboard tools. Select this option if the widget should respond to changes in other widgets or another external way.
dashboard.widget-without-alias: A widget without an alias can change its data only using the view filter. Usually, this option should be selected when the widget will be more static (the data will not depend on other widgets, query parameters etc.).

models.acceptable-time-deviation: The acceptable difference in time between actual and expected values.
models.acceptable-units-deviation: The acceptable difference in units between actual and expected values.
models.fill-gap: A tool for filling in missing telemetry using one of the selected methods.
models.key: Telemetry name for saving prediction model result in ThingsBoard: "_EPD_your-model-key"
models.prediction-range: Length of prediction period (as number of selected units).
models.prediction-segment: Select a segment to compare real data with predicted values.
models.segment-strategy: The algorithm which would be used to distribute testing segments over historical data
models.segments-amount: The system divides real-time telemetry into segments to calculate prediction accuracy. With Auto mode, the system automatically selects the optimal number of segments. With Manual mode, you can specify the number of segments yourself.
models.timerange-warning: Selected timerange is insufficient to produce a valid result. You can train the model on this data, but the prediction accuracy might be low.

view-field.card-with-line-range-colors: Show a menu to manually control the color range of the dynamics change number and icons. By default, 2 colors are automatically applied - green and red (positive and negative dynamics). You can reverse it in the visualization settings (right menu). If you set at least one color manually, then the automatic mode will turn off.
view-field.calc-aggregation: Date formatting. Only the RAW format allows you to select the interval for telemetry aggregation.
view-field.chart-type: Additional chart settings for more accurate visualization.
view-field.data-aggregation: Method for search, combine and process data.
view-field.date-aggregation: Date formatting. Only the RAW format allows you to select the interval for telemetry aggregation.
view-field.decimal-points: Number of decimal places after numeric telemetry.
view-field.delta: This can be useful when you are working with telemetry with a pulse output (telemetry value always growing). And you need to look at the dynamics of changes.
view-field.disabled-decimal-points: Number of decimal places after numeric telemetry. Only active when auto formatting is enabled.
view-field.enable-auto-formatting: By default, automatic formatting is applied to all numeric values, which includes removing leading zeros, rounding to the specified number of characters, and more. Disabling this function will be useful for cases like model names, serial numbers, etc., where the input is not a typical numeric value.
view-field.enable-filter-auto-refresh: Loading the list of elements for the selected filters in real time. By default, the actual list of these elements is loaded during the creation of the view (after pressing the 'Build' buttons)
view-field.engine: The language used in the code entry field.
view-field.export-state-duration-in-ms-text: When exporting to xls or csv, the duration value will be retained in milliseconds and will not be converted to a human-readable format. This can be beneficial for programmatic post-processing of data. Other data in date format will not be affected by this setting.
view-field.fill-gap: Automatically fill gaps in telemetry with the selected type of aggregated values.
view-field.filter-from-url-help-text: The ability to get filtering parameters for the ThingsBoard widget using the URL line (query parameters) of the browser.
view-field.filter-to-url-help-text: The ability to set filtering parameters for the ThingsBoard widget using the URL line (query parameters) of the browser.
view-field.heat-map-hide-label-warn: Please note that if the values do not fit in the cells, they will be hidden automatically regardless of this setting.
view-field.historical-part: Show or hide real (historical) data in a visualization.
view-field.is-hidden: Hide the column in the table that refers to this field (visual only).
view-field.label: The name of the field that will be displayed in the visualization and when exporting data. Try to keep the names of different fields unique.
view-field.local-date: The function allows you to compare different time ranges for the same entity. For example, you can compare the same telemetry data for different time periods by displaying it in separate columns of a table, representing it as different bars on a chart etc.
view-field.prediction: Instruments for forecast how the current telemetry data will evolve over a specific future time period.
view-field.prediction-range: Length of prediction period (as number of selected units).
view-field.preview-disabled-select-top-text: A sort type should be selected.
view-field.preview-disabled-sort-text: Works only when the chart has no dates.
view-field.preview-mode-help-text: The ability to load only part of the data to quickly see how the view will look.
view-field.reverse-comparison-help-text: Works only when there are no manually set ranges (normal, critical, warning).
view-field.rotate-export-text: Changes the vertical / horizontal direction in the export result.
view-field.row-click-entity: An entity that will be passed on a click on a view element (table row, bar of chart, etc.) to the ThingsBoard alias. This is usually used to change filters of view in other widgets.
view-field.round-units: The function allows you to shorten the length of numbers by replacing signs with letters (thousand - k, million - m, billion - b).
view-field.save-field: Save the template of the calculated field for future reuse. The saved field will appear on the left side of the rest of the objects and can be dragged in the same way for visualizations.
view-field.show-toolbox: Displays a toolbox in the upper right corner of the visualization that allows you to export and zoom in on a selection for some types of visualizations.
view-field.state-aggregation: Duration display: absolute or relative format.
view-field.tb-calculated-telemetry-save: It feature provides the ability to make and save (to the same item) a new telemetry that is made by a calculation field that is derived from any telemetry field that you want. It is a scheduled action that will be launched every chosen time unit to keep actual values during the present time.
view-field.unit: Post-value display: units, currency, percentage, etc.

view-settings.annotations: Color Zones on the chart for ranges along the Y axis.
view-settings.cache-report: If the query plan is not changed will be return cached View Report without loading data from ThingsBoard.
view-settings.cant-use-sort-with-raw-warn: If the date format is RAW or START_OF_WEEK, sorting will not work on the chart. Try selecting or another date format and rebuild view.
view-settings.enable-caching: In cases when data can be grouped by fixed intervals, like Hour or Date, will be load already computed\aggregated field value from cache instead of reloading data from ThingsBoard.
view-settings.enable-filter-auto-refresh: Loading the list of elements for the selected filters in real time. By default, the actual list of these elements is loaded during the creation of the view (after pressing the 'Build' buttons)
view-settings.entities-root: Manual select Root Entity during view calculation (what Entity selected as Root for the request).
view-settings.export-state-duration-in-ms-text: When exporting to xls or csv, the duration value will be retained in milliseconds and will not be converted to a human-readable format. This can be beneficial for programmatic post-processing of data. Other data in date format will not be affected by this setting.
view-settings.filter-from-url-help-text: The ability to get filtering parameters for the ThingsBoard widget using the URL line (query parameters) of the browser.
view-settings.filter-to-url-help-text: The ability to set filtering parameters for the ThingsBoard widget using the URL line (query parameters) of the browser.
view-settings.heat-map-hide-label-warn: Please note that if the values do not fit in the cells, they will be hidden automatically regardless of this setting.
view-settings.hidden-filters: Hide specific filters when displayed in the ThingsBoard widget.
view-settings.preview-disabled-sort-text: Works only when the chart has no dates.
view-settings.preview-mode-help-text: The ability to load only part of the data to quickly see how the view will look.
view-settings.remove-empty-series: Remove entities without telemetry from the view.
view-settings.reverse-comparison-help-text: Works only when there are no manually set ranges (normal, critical, warning).
view-settings.rotate-export-text: Changes the vertical / horizontal direction in the export result.
view-settings.row-click-entity: An entity that will be passed on a click on a view element (table row, bar of chart, etc.) to the ThingsBoard alias. This is usually used to change filters of view in other widgets.
view-settings.show-timeline: Add a timeline at the bottom of the chart for quick selection of time periods (zoom).
view-settings.show-toolbox: Displays a toolbox in the upper right corner of the visualization that allows you to export and zoom in on a selection for some types of visualizations.
view-settings.single-y-axis: Join all Y-axis and show on single axis (useful when the y-axis uses multiple fields with the same unit of measure).
view-settings.tb-calculated-telemetry-save: It feature provides the ability to make and save (to the same item) a new telemetry that is made by a calculation field that is derived from any telemetry field that you want. It is a scheduled action that will be launched every chosen time unit to keep actual values during the present time.
view-settings.topology-entities: Manual modify what entities included in the query plan.

topology.device-automatically-detection-info: and all Devices/Assets will be automatically detected in the connected instance
topology.discovery-in-progress: Topology Discovery in progress. Please wait
topology.no-entities-discovered: Looks like no Assets and Devices were discovered yet.

views.bad-anomaly-model: This model contains errors. Try to choose another one.
views.delete-warning: You will not be able to restore these views after that. Are you sure?
views.no-data-anomaly: There are no anomalies for the selected period

general.filter-in-export: Filter to show in XLS file
general.show-export: Show daterange and filters information in XLS/XLSX file
general.tooltip-xaxis-max: The max value can't be less than the min
general.tooltip-yaxis-max: The max value can't be less than the min

views.tooltip-share: Only the saved item can be shared
views.tooltip-view-mode: Only a saved item can be opened
